Main.ServerFuncs package

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper module

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.checkSentiment(chatHistory: list) → float[source]

This method calculates the average sentiment of the last 5 messages in the chatHistory

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return sentiment_value:

average sentiment of the last 5 messages

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.create_chatbot(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient[source]

This method creates a chatbot and forwards a list of the last 5 messages to it

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return message:

Answer from the chatbot

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.is_message_addressing_bot(message_str: str) → bool[source]

This method analyses if a message is addressing the chatbot. For this, it compares the similarity of the incoming string with the keyword “botify”

Parameters:

message_str – Incoming message as a string

Return Bool:

True if the incoming message is addressing the chatbot, False otherwise

Main.ServerFuncs.ChatHelper.listenToMessages(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient | None[source]

This method listens to incoming messages and determines whether the chatbot should be called

Parameters:

chatHistory – List of last 5 messages in the chat

Return message object or None:

either return a message from the chatbot or None if the chatbot is not addressed
